fields.description:
Hi,

when releasing a version which still has open issues the user is asked what (s)he wants to do with the open issues: 
- ignore them
- move them to another version which has to be choosen

At the moment there is no confirmation pop-up. When you click release, the version is released and the issues are ignored or moved.

It would be good to have a confirmation pop-up/screen whether user is sure what he does. And in case of moving the open issues to another version it would be good to have an overview screen which issues are moved (likewise when moving an issue to another project).

Cheers,
Irene
fields.summary: Confirmation question when releasing version with open issues

fields.description:
The Administration > Services option is intended to allow users to turn emails into JIRA updates, but the terminology used in the UI does not match the user model of how emails should be processed. The current design makes it too easy for users to confuse the forward email for JIRA output with the incoming POP mailbox. The UI should be revised so that users are able to determine what the incoming email is for each service when viewing that service, rather than having to identify the 'pop server' as a mailbox with an email server. The term 'pop server' should also not be used to describe a pop account.

-- Old UI --
MAIL SERVERS
Create Or Update
Host: mail.example.com
Username: create

SERVICES
popserver: Create Or Update
forwardEmail: errors@example.com
-- Old UI --

The improved UI will query the pop account it is associated with to retrieve both the incoming email address and the description. The names are also less ambiguous.

-- Alternative UI --
SERVICES
Mailbox Description: Create Or Update
Incoming Mailbox: input@example.com
Outgoing Mailbox: errors@example.com
-- Alternative UI --
fields.summary: Pop account for Services is misleadingly named 'Pop Server' and does not disclose email address

fields.description:
Currently importing data with attachments fails against the Bugzilla 2.22.2 database due to a schema change in that version.

From [the forums|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=16538]:

{panel}

I am trying to use Bugzilla importer provided by Jira to import all the bugs in Bugzilla 2.22 (and 2.22.2) into Jira 3.7.4. However, I have found out that the attachments will not be migrated into Jira and I have gotten the following errors:

[21:09:36] Importing Issue: "test with attachment"
[21:09:37] Error on importing attachments for bug 8. Error:Column 'thedata' not found.

After searching a little bit more, I have found that the database schema of Bugzilla has been changed since 2.21.1. In Bugzilla 2.21.1, a new table named attach_data was introduced to handle big attachment. However, the Bugzilla importer for Jira 3.7.4 (even 3.8) is still using the schema for Bugzilla 1.8.

Here comes my question:

Is there anybody who has a fix for this? If so, could you please share your fix(es) with me?
{panel}
fields.summary: JIRA BugzillaImporter needs to be made compatible with Bugzilla 2.22.2

fields.summary: Data anonymiser does not blank out SMTP server username and password

fields.description:
Hacker can try as many time he wants to login JIRA.  

You can build client, which sends username+password combinations as many time as you like.

.. and if you have username, it is much easier to get in.

----

Implementation ideas:
1) Lock user after sequential X incorrect logins 
  - X can be set by administrator
  - if admin's own username is locked, it should be possible to unlock from console
2) Set IP to blacklist (unable to try login) after sequential Y incorrect logins  
  - Y can be set by administrator
  - IP can be removed from Blacklist by admin and it also should be possible to do from console

2) can be also done by using "bullet time" after sequential Z incorrect logins
  - when hacker has been tried Z times to login then login period will take time 10 times longer
  - when hacker has been tried 2*Z times to login then login period will take time 2*10 times longer
  - .. until Y is reached and IP is set to blacklist
fields.summary: Implement user lockout mechanism to stop bruteforce login attacks

fields.description: It would be really useful to have a workflow plugin that allowed you to supply a script (bsh, groovy etc.) for a post function, condition, etc. through the web interface as an alternative to developing a full-fledged class, compiling it and packaging it into a JAR file.  This would significantly reduce the start-up cost associated with custom workflow logic.
fields.summary: scripted (vs. compiled) workflow plugins
Allow filtering by excluded assignee

fields.description:
The {{getActionIdByName()}} method in the class {{com.atlassian.jira.jelly.tag.issue.TransitionWorkflow}} doesn't validate the status of an issue before returning the action back to the calling function.

For instance, in JIRA default workflow, an issue in the status of "Resolved" (step '4'), its "Close Issue" action is having the id '701'. Specifying "Close Issue" in the {{workflowAction}} attribute will return this error message:

{noformat}org.apache.commons.jelly.JellyTagException: null:2:0:  The following problems were found: Action 2 is invalid{noformat}

This is reproducible by using the Jelly script below:

{code:xml}<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
  <jira:TransitionWorkflow key="TPJ-2" user="admin" workflowAction="Close Issue" />
</JiraJelly>{code}

We can get around this by specifying id instead of the action name.
fields.summary: Jelly's TransitionWorkflow getActionIdByName() to be aware of issue's status

fields.description:
It is nice that you can add descriptions for project components, but these are very "second class" descriptions compared to the descriptions of issues.

The "Browse Project" page lists the components, but they are merely links to searches, rather than pages describing the component (i.e. showing the description in more than a tooltip). Many other things would be relevant on such a "component" page - component-filtered versions of most of the things found at the "Project" level of abstraction. Since components have leads, these are very relevant pages for those leads. More than just a query result is warranted.
fields.summary: Create a Browse Components page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12362].
  {panel}

I recently opened a support request because my 'Assignee' email notifications were not being generated, even though 'Current Assignee' was a recipient of all 'Issue Assigned'.

I was setting the assignee of issues three ways:
1. Using the 'Assign to' link
2. Setting the assignee while editing an issue, using 'Edit'
3. Setting the assignee during a transition

Because the current assignee was not a recipient of 'Issue Updated' and 'Work Started on Issue' events, no email notifications were sent. 

I am requesting that all relevant events be triggered each time the event occurs. For example if an assignee and fix version is set while editing an issue, this should trigger both Issue Updated & Issue Assigned. If an assignee & fix version is set while transitioning to In Progress, this should trigger 'Work Started on Issue', 'Issue Updated', and 'Issue Assigned'.

All relevant events should be triggered, and the recipient should receive a single notification. In our particular application, we want the current assignee to receive a notification each time they are assigned, but only the watchers to receive notification when an issue is updated. Sending the current assignee emails every time an issue is updated by anybody (they are able to disable notifications for their own changes) is far too many notifications for our needs. Unfortunately, including Current assignee to the Issue Updated list is the only way to get them to receive AT LEAST the assignee emails.
fields.summary: Fire all notification scheme events regardless of whether or not other events have been activated

fields.description:
The Exception below was thrown when viewing an issue where the assignee had recently been removed from a Crowd Directory.  

I think JIRA should handle this scenario, allowing the issue to be viewed regardless. Ideally the history of who worked on what could be preserved even if the user has left us. We don't want to leave them in the directory just to avoid these errors. A major reason for this is licensing on our Active Directory combined with a very high turnover of staff.  

There are related issues about deactivating issues including http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2220 but none for Crowd it seems.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12355].
  {panel}

So I'm fairly new to JIRA, but I search around to see if this is already logged, and it seems not.

I'd like to use the watcher list just like the cc list in Bugzilla.  All users can see who is watching, and can add others to the watch list.  the one thing you don't want is for someone to get removed from the watch list without their knowledge.

One way to do this is to not enable anyone but the user themselves to remove themselves, which would work if JRA-7739 was implemented.

But as the product stands now, correct operation should ensure that someone who is removed be notified of the change; they can always add themselves back if they wish.
fields.summary: A Watching user is not notified when they are removed from the Watcher list

fields.summary: Version Control shows logs of wrong issue

fields.description:
The display of version numbers on their release dates in the calendar is a vital feature for us. However if you have version names defined such as "1.2 - new ad campaign" it will summarize the version number to:

"1..."  which is completely useless. As a result we have to edit all our version names to "1.2" and put "new ad campaign" only in the description - then the calendar will show "1.2" and be useful.

However then when we create/edit issues the affects/fix-for version fields we only get numbers i.e.:

1.3
1.2
1.1
1.0

Which makes it difficult for people to know which is which, as previously it would show the full name:

1.3
1.2 - new ad campaign
1.1
1.0

Not sure about the best solution - perhaps get version select boxes to show the version description alongside? Maybe in a separate Javascript / Ajax "panel" as a compromise?

This affects the usefulness of the calendars massively for us as the managers don't want to lose version descriptions as people just raise things against the wrong versions with no text there.
fields.summary: Calendar portlet version number display needs improvement, hard to see version numbers

fields.description:
The calendar portlet lets you set number of issues shown per day, but this is ignored when exporting the iCAL feed.

As a result you cannot get an iCAL feed containing only version due dates, without hundreds of issue events also occurring if they have a due date set individually.
fields.summary: Make Calendar Plugin support limiting issues exported in iCAL feed

fields.description:
When using the AJAXy operations to refresh screens in an iframe, resizing window can cause issues.

The problem is that the iframe is not resized when the browser window is resized, and therefore the submit buttons of the form showing in the iframe can become hidden, making teh user unable to submit the form.
fields.summary: Resizing of window does not work with the AJAXy issue operation screens

fields.description: When using the AJAXy operations that load the screens into an iframe, if there is text that wraps (long descriptions or message fields), the buttons become hidden.
fields.summary: AJAX Issue operations do not resize iframe correctly when there is text that wraps

fields.description:
If you modify users/groups in a project's project role and this project uses an issue security scheme, you must remove the role and re-add it to the issue security scheme for the role changes to take effect.

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Need to be the admin of  a project whose issue creation screen has the security level field and of which you have permission to set issue security level.
2.  Create Issue Security Scheme with two levels (Level A and Level B).
3.  Add the Administrator role to Level A and the User role to Level B.
4.  Assign the Issue Security Scheme to your project.
5.  Add yourself to Project A's Administrator Role.
6.  Look at the options available under Security Level.   You will only see None.

Even though you've added yourself to the Administrator role, you won't have the ability to set the issue security to Level A unless you delete and re-add the Administrator role to the Level A security level.
fields.summary: Project Role Modifications not reflected in Issue Security Scheme

fields.description:
Currently, {{getOptionForValue}} in {{OptionsImpl}} uses case-insensitive checking, e.g. {{option.getValue().equalsIgnoreCase(value)}}. I am not too sure about the possible harm of it, however, say if you are inserting a value into a customfield via Jelly upon creation, e.g.

{code:xml}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TPJ" summary="Issue Summary" reporter="yclian" assignee="yclian" issueKeyVar="issuekey" issueIdVar="issueid">
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10000" value="feature"/>
</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

Given that *"Feature"* is one of the options defined in {{customfield_10000}}, the validation will pass and the value *"feature"* will be applied. One of the consequences, when someone tries to edit that issue, the <select/> field will not preselect the right value as it uses case sensitive comparison, i.e.

{noformat}#if ($value && $value == $option.value)selected#end{noformat}

What matters is the value being set in the database is simply not the right one.
fields.summary: Options's getOptionForValue being case insensitive may lead to consistency problem?
Expose the filter sharing data in RemoteFilter

fields.description:
Moving an issue between projects preserves the status of the orginating issue.
The status is (and should be) controlled by the project's workflow.
Even if the workflows are the same between the projects, the people allowed to perform the transitions not.
The result is that the moved issue circumvents the workflow and team responsible for approving/transitioning the issue. Issues are often lost, because they don't enter the workflow at the beginning.

The Moved issue should retain all the data from the orginal issue, but start in whatever the status the workflow sets as the "created" status.

This is related to JRA-5159
fields.summary: Move Issue should create the new issues in the initial workflow status.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap; however, there are a number of third-party plugins mentioned in [this post from Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/47652/jql-jira-filter-on-worklog] that can accomplish this.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

I am looking for a way to search for all tasks that a specific user has been involved with.  

For example:
Tom creates a jira task and assigns it to Sally.
Sally logs work against the task and runs into a road block that only Jim can solve.
Sally assigns the task to Jim.
Jim logs work on the task and assigns it back to Sally.
Sally logs work and resolves the task.
Tom reviews and closes the task.

The task now shows Tom as the reporter and the Assignee.  There is no way to know that Sally and Jim worked on the task.  

It would be nice to have a search option to find out that  Sally (or Jim) contributed to the task.

This relates somewhat to JRA-6137
fields.summary: Search by work log user entries
Allow automatically recurring tasks to be generated
Make JIRA search accessible via OpenSearch

fields.description:
Wiki preview functionality does not work if a client uses Internet Explorer 6.
Whatever is entered into a comment window (with wiki render enabled), it disappears (empty preview window) after pressing on preview button. After clicking one more time on the button (now edit), user gets back his or her original text. 
IE reports "Error on page" - see attachment.

Rendering entered (saved) comments works well.

There is no trace of exception in the log file, only standard:
{panel}
INFO: Exec[0]: RendererPreviewAjaxUtil.getPreviewHtml()
Mar 2, 2007 3:54:16 PM uk.ltd.getahead.dwr.util.CommonsLoggingOutput info
{panel}

Problem doesn't occur in FireFox 2.0
fields.summary: Wiki preview in comments doesn't work with Internet Explorer 6
Oracle DB Text Columns Exceed 255 Character Limit on Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12303].
  {panel}

Changing a workflow takes too long (16h) and other processes can interfer (automatic backup). 
Because of the interferance the new workflow wasn't activated and most of the issues were converted to the new workflow (nobody could change these issues to resolved, closed, ...) I'm told that you need to redo the workflow change until all issues are converted (but if this takes 16 h everytime then it's not worth the trouble). So for everybodies sake I had to restore a backup to get everything going again.

It seems the workflow activation needs a workover to improve its speed and to ensure that nothing can interfere while it's running. 
It seems there's a missing indirection because every issue has to be changed when the workflow changes.
The workflow only consists of a little amount of steps. If you put something between the issue and the workflow then you should be able to change it in a few seconds and see problems when there are missing steps that can't convert. Normally you add stuff to a workflow so there shouldn't be a need to change the issue because all the steps that where in the previous workflow are also in the new workflow

Also there is nothing in the log or on the screen that gives you an indication what's going on or wrong or if it succeeded, ...

Documentation for the prof. edition only states how to activate a workflow (It wasn't hard to adjust but is this really all, no warnings that it takes allmost a day, that other processes will interfer)
fields.summary: Workflow needs workover
Newly created project doesn't contain "id"
affectsVersion field cannot be updated via SOAP or XMLRPC

fields.description:
I need to have the possibility to send the detail of on issue to a person *at any moment*, punctually.
Today, we are using the notification scheme to send an email on specific action.
But sometimes, we want to send the issue to a dedicated personn (not reporter, not assignee, not watchers), just to show him the issue or warn him of an action on the issue. 

It can be a link "Send Email", after clicking on it, we can choose the receiver : single user, reporter, watchers, current assignee, project leader , group...
fields.summary: To have the possibility to send an email exceptionnaly

fields.description:
When I build weblogic.war an error message printout.It is "tmp\build\weblogic not find".So I add  following content after line <mkdir dir="${dist-weblogic}"/> in 170
  <mkdir dir="${build.weblogic}"/>
and then every thing is ok.
Remember:You only need to change "bea.home" ,"wl.home","wl.java" and don`t modify any other content in build.xml.
BTW:The method of "build a generic war and deploy to weblogic server" is not right.

My environment:
OS:Windows XP SP2
App Server:Weblogic 8.1 SP6
JIRA Vesion:Enterprise 3.7.4
DB:Oracle 10g
fields.summary: Solve the problem "tmp\build\weblogic not find' when build weblogic.war

fields.description:
The documentation specifies that the "user" attribute will be used, instead of the one being shown in the example:

{code:xml}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:RemoveUser username="existing-user"/>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

The correct one is "user" anyway.
fields.summary: "username" attribute should be replaced by "user" in Jelly RemoveUser tag example

fields.description:
During initial JIRA database setup, if JIRA is configured to use an immutable User/Group provider (eg. LDAP or Crowd) and there are no Users already in the "jira-administrators" group, JIRA demands that a new user be created - which JIRA then adds to the "jira-administrators" group. This then fails as the Group database is immutable (read-only).

To workaround this, the user must create a user and put them in the "jira-administrators" group in the external store.
fields.summary: JIRA Setup should not make the creation of an admin user mandatory

fields.description:
When doing JIRA support, we frequently have just the log file. It would be very convenient to have the JIRA system info printed in the log on startup. Of particular use would be:
 - JDBC driver details, as reported by the driver.
 - Memory (max available).
 - Operating system.
 - Plugins *other* than those bundled with JIRA normally.
 - System profiling info (JRA-12270).
fields.summary: Print system info to the logs on startup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12270].
  {panel}

Every now and then people report performance problems, which after much effort, are traced down to a very slow filesystem (eg. NFS or virus checker), slow CPU (eg. old Sun servers running 16x 500Mhz CPUs) or slow network connection (database running remotely).

We should write some functions to profile these aspects, and print the milliseconds taken on the System Info page:

 - Exercise Lucene (create, populate, select from a test lucene index) to test the disk the index is on.
 - Run a few hundred SELECTs and INSERTs on the database to test its speed.
 - Sort a large array to test the CPU speed.
fields.summary: Print disk and CPU profiling stats on System Info page

fields.description:
We settled on port 8095 as the default port for Crowd. The default port path of http://localhost:8085/crowd/services/ should be http://localhost:8095/crowd/services/

The path of JIRA should also be changed to http://localhost:8080 rather than http://localhost:8080/jira/.
fields.summary: Change 'crowd.properties' default port to be 8095 rather than 8085.

fields.description:
Use case:
A manager, team lead, etc. needs to find "all tickets that relate to a version".  We'll call it Version 1.0.
This means *both* any ticket that was tagged as "found in version 1.0", *OR* any ticket that is "planned to be fixed in version 1.0"

Currently this is impossible, because it requires an "OR" concept in the query (affects-version=1.0 OR fix-version=1.0)  JIRA lets you do OR *within* many fields (select multiple) but there is no way to do an OR across two (or more) different fields.

Not sure how something like this would be best represented in the UI.  The advanced-search options are already complex enough, so I don't know if you should add anything there.  

"OR" searches are sometimes represented in other apps by the metaphor of "stacking" or "joining" searches.  Ex.  Create Filter A, then create Filter B, then create a filter that is the result of A and B.  You could, near the top of the "new filter" UI, give a link "Create combined filter" that takes the user to a simple UI where N number of listboxes are presented each filled with the list of currently-saved filters (and of course the predefined ones too.)

This is somewhat related to JRA-7772, but I don't think it's an exact duplicate.
fields.summary: Unable to do "OR" searches in different fields

Please see attached code for more details. In order to make it work you will need to replace the following information:

Group name for getGroup on user.rb
